snippet: The discovery of a rare protective genetic mutation provides strong evidence that the buildup of beta amyloid protein in the brain is a driving force in Alzheimer’s disease.
abstract: Discovery of a rare protective genetic mutation that protects people against Alzheimer's disease provides strong evidence that the buildup of beta amyloid protein in the brain is a driving force in the disease; study reported in journal Nature bolsters hopes that anti-amyloid drugs already in development might alter the disease's course or even prevent it.
lead_paragraph: The discovery of a rare protective genetic mutation provides strong evidence that the buildup of beta amyloid protein in the brain is a driving force in Alzheimer’s disease.

headline.seo: Rare Gene Mutation Is Found to Stave Off Alzheimer’s
headline.main: In Preventing Alzheimer’s, Mutation May Aid Drug Quest
headline.print_headline: Rare Mutation May Help Fight On Alzheimer’s
